item.title: Npcforcechat with "+c.playername + ".");
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Did you capitalize the “c”? That is a must, since your class is named Client.java, not client.java. Also, make sure your Client class doesn’t have a user-defined constructor in there. If so, then you have to follow its parameters.

Read full topic

item.title: Npcforcechat with "+c.playername + ".");
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Just add this at the top of your class then.
Client c = new Client();

item.title: Npcforcechat with "+c.playername + ".");
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Oh my god…

Find,

            if (npcs[i].actionTimer > 0) {
                  npcs[i].actionTimer--;
            }

Then under actionTimer–; Add this,

	if (npcs[i].npcType == 2262) // Staff zone NPC.
	{
		if (Misc.random2(15) <= 3)
		{
			npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
			npcs[i].forceChat("Welcome to the staffzone, " + c.playerName); // Sent text string
		}
	}

Read full topic

if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan))

npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].forceChat("Welcome to the staffzone, "+ c.playerName + “.”);
}
